        • This subpackage qrem.common provides a suite of utility modules specifically tailored for the QREM project. It encompasses a range of functionalities from configuration loading to mathematical computations and file operations in the context of Quantum Error Mitigation (QEM).

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpaÔÉÅ

Ncpol2SDPA package by Peter Wittek. Provides:

  1. A converter from a polynomial optimization problems of commuting and noncommuting variables to a semidefinite programming relaxation.

  2. Helper functions to define physics problems.

As current version of the package available on PyPI contains minor issues, original package was moved and modified to be used as a submodule of QREM package.

class qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.FaacetsRelaxationÔÉÅ

Bases: qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.sdp_relaxation.Relaxation

Class for wrapping around a Faacets relaxation.

get_relaxation(A_configuration, B_configuration, I)ÔÉÅ

Get the sparse SDP relaxation of a Bell inequality.

Parameters:

  • A_configuration (list of list of int.) ‚Äì The definition of measurements of Alice.

  • B_configuration (list of list of int.) ‚Äì The definition of measurements of Bob.

  • I (list of list of int.) ‚Äì The matrix describing the Bell inequality in the Collins-Gisin picture.

class qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.SdpRelaxation(variables, parameters=None, verbose=0, normalized=True, parallel=False, number_of_threads=None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: Relaxation

Class for obtaining sparse SDP relaxation.

Parameters:

  • variables (list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator or a list of list.) ‚Äì Commutative or noncommutative, Hermitian or nonhermiatian variables, possibly a list of list of variables if the hierarchy is not NPA.

  • parameters (list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator or a list of list.) ‚Äì Optional symbolic variables for which moments are not generated.

  • verbose (int.) ‚Äì

    Optional parameter for level of verbosity:

    • 0: quiet (default)

    • 1: verbose

    • 2: debug level

  • normalized (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter for changing the normalization of states over which the optimization happens. Turn it off if further processing is done on the SDP matrix before solving it.

  • parallel (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter for allowing parallel computations.

  • number_of_threads (int.) ‚Äì set the number of threads if parallel is True. If None, use cpu_count() of multiprocess.

- `monomial_sets`

The monomial sets that generate the moment matrix blocks.

- `monomial_index`

Dictionary that maps monomials to SDP variables.

- `constraints`

The complete set of constraints after preprocesssing.

- `primal`

The primal optimal value.

- `dual`

The dual optimal value.

- `x_mat`

The primal solution matrix.

- `y_mat`

The dual solution matrix.

- `solution_time`

The amount of time taken to solve the relaxation.

- `status`

The solution status of the relaxation.

Generate the moment matrix of monomials.

Arguments: n_vars ‚Äì current number of variables block_index ‚Äì current block index in the SDP matrix monomials ‚Äì |W_d| set of words of length up to the relaxation level

__push_facvar_sparse(polynomial, block_index, row_offset, i, j)ÔÉÅ

Calculate the sparse vector representation of a polynomial and pushes it to the F structure.

_get_facvar(polynomial)ÔÉÅ

Return dense vector representation of a polynomial. This function is nearly identical to __push_facvar_sparse, but instead of pushing sparse entries to the constraint matrices, it returns a dense vector.

__wipe_F_from_constraints()ÔÉÅ
process_constraints(inequalities=None, equalities=None, momentinequalities=None, momentequalities=None, block_index=0, removeequalities=False)ÔÉÅ

Process the constraints and generate localizing matrices. Useful only if the moment matrix already exists. Call it if you want to replace your constraints. The number of the respective types of constraints and the maximum degree of each constraint must remain the same.

Parameters:

  • inequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to list inequality constraints.

  • equalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to list equality constraints.

  • momentinequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of inequalities defined on moments.

  • momentequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of equalities defined on moments.

  • removeequalities (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to attempt removing the equalities by solving the linear equations.

  • removeequalities ‚Äì Optional parameter to attempt removing the equalities by solving the linear equations.

set_objective(objective, extraobjexpr=None)ÔÉÅ

Set or change the objective function of the polynomial optimization problem.

Parameters:

  • objective (sympy.core.expr.Expr) ‚Äì Describes the objective function.

  • extraobjexpr (str.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of a string expression of a linear combination of moment matrix elements to be included in the objective function

get_sos_decomposition(threshold=0.0)ÔÉÅ

Given a solution of the dual problem, it returns the SOS decomposition.

Parameters:

threshold (float.) ‚Äì Optional parameter for specifying the threshold value below which the eigenvalues and entries of the eigenvectors are disregarded.

Returns:

The SOS decomposition of [sigma_0, sigma_1, ‚Ä¶, sigma_m]

Return type:

list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.

extract_dual_value(monomial, blocks=None)ÔÉÅ

Given a solution of the dual problem and a monomial, it returns the inner product of the corresponding coefficient matrix and the dual solution. It can be restricted to certain blocks.

Parameters:

  • monomial (sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì The monomial for which the value is requested.

  • monomial ‚Äì The monomial for which the value is requested.

  • blocks (list of int.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to specify the blocks to be included.

Returns:

The value of the monomial in the solved relaxation.

Return type:

float.

find_solution_ranks(xmat=None, baselevel=0)ÔÉÅ

Helper function to detect rank loop in the solution matrix.

Parameters:

  • sdpRelaxation (ncpol2sdpa.SdpRelaxation.) ‚Äì The SDP relaxation.

  • x_mat (numpy.array.) ‚Äì Optional parameter providing the primal solution of the moment matrix. If not provided, the solution is extracted from the sdpRelaxation object.

  • base_level (int.) ‚Äì Optional parameter for specifying the lower level relaxation for which the rank loop should be tested against.

Returns:

list of int ‚Äì the ranks of the solution matrix with in the order of increasing degree.

get_dual(constraint, ymat=None)ÔÉÅ

Given a solution of the dual problem and a constraint of any type, it returns the corresponding block in the dual solution. If it is an equality constraint that was converted to a pair of inequalities, it returns a two-tuple of the matching dual blocks.

Parameters:

  • constraint ‚Äì The constraint.

  • y_mat (numpy.array.) ‚Äì Optional parameter providing the dual solution of the SDP. If not provided, the solution is extracted from the sdpRelaxation object.

Returns:

The corresponding block in the dual solution.

Return type:

numpy.array or a tuple thereof.

write_to_file(filename, filetype=None)ÔÉÅ

Write the relaxation to a file.

Parameters:

  • filename (str.) ‚Äì The name of the file to write to. The type can be autodetected from the extension: .dat-s for SDPA, .task for mosek or .csv for human readable format.

  • filetype (str.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to define the filetype. It can be ‚Äúsdpa‚Äù for SDPA , ‚Äúmosek‚Äù for Mosek, or ‚Äúcsv‚Äù for human readable format.

save_monomial_index(filename)ÔÉÅ

Write the monomial index to a file.

Parameters:

filename (str.) ‚Äì The name of the file to write to.

convert_to_cvxpy()ÔÉÅ

Convert an SDP relaxation to a CVXPY problem.

Returns:

cvxpy.Problem.

convert_to_picos(duplicate_moment_matrix=False)ÔÉÅ

Convert the SDP relaxation to a PICOS problem such that the exported .dat-s file is extremely sparse, there is not penalty imposed in terms of SDP variables or number of constraints. This conversion can be used for imposing extra constraints on the moment matrix, such as partial transpose.

Parameters:

duplicate_moment_matrix (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to add an unconstrained moment matrix to the problem with the same structure as the moment matrix with the PSD constraint.

Returns:

picos.Problem.

convert_to_mosek()ÔÉÅ

Convert an SDP relaxation to a MOSEK task.

Returns:

mosek.Task.

get_relaxation(level, objective=None, inequalities=None, equalities=None, substitutions=None, momentinequalities=None, momentequalities=None, momentsubstitutions=None, removeequalities=False, extramonomials=None, extramomentmatrices=None, extraobjexpr=None, localizing_monomials=None, chordal_extension=False)ÔÉÅ

Get the SDP relaxation of a noncommutative polynomial optimization problem.

Parameters:

  • level (int.) ‚Äì The level of the relaxation. The value -1 will skip automatic monomial generation and use only the monomials supplied by the option extramonomials.

  • obj (sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to describe the objective function.

  • inequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to list inequality constraints.

  • equalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to list equality constraints.

  • substitutions (dict of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter containing monomials that can be replaced (e.g., idempotent variables).

  • momentinequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of inequalities defined on moments.

  • momentequalities (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of equalities defined on moments.

  • momentsubstitutions (dict of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter containing moments that can be replaced.

  • removeequalities (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to attempt removing the equalities by solving the linear equations.

  • extramonomials (list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional paramter of monomials to be included, on top of the requested level of relaxation.

  • extramomentmatrices (list of list of str.) ‚Äì Optional paramter of duplicating or adding moment matrices. A new moment matrix can be unconstrained (‚Äú‚Äù), a copy of the first one (‚Äúcopy‚Äù), and satisfying a partial positivity constraint (‚Äúppt‚Äù). Each new moment matrix is requested as a list of string of these options. For instance, adding a single new moment matrix as a copy of the first would be extramomentmatrices=[["copy"]].

  • extraobjexpr (str.) ‚Äì Optional parameter of a string expression of a linear combination of moment matrix elements to be included in the objective function.

  • localizing_monomials (list of list of sympy.core.exp.Expr.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to specify sets of localizing monomials for each constraint. The internal order of constraints is inequalities first, followed by the equalities. If the parameter is specified, but for a certain constraint the automatic localization is requested, leave None in its place in this parameter.

  • chordal_extension (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to request a sparse chordal extension.

class qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.SteeringHierarchy(variables, verbose=0, matrix_var_dim=None, mark_conjugate=False, parallel=False)ÔÉÅ

Bases: qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.sdp_relaxation.SdpRelaxation

Class for obtaining a step in the steering hierarchy.

Parameters:

  • variables (list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator or a list of list.) ‚Äì Commutative or noncommutative, Hermitian or nonhermiatian variables.

  • verbose (int.) ‚Äì

    Optional parameter for level of verbosity:

    • 0: quiet

    • 1: verbose

    • 2: debug level

  • matrix_var_dim (int.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to specify the size of matrix variable blocks

  • mark_conjugate (bool.) ‚Äì Use this optional parameter to generate a symbolic representation of the steering hierarchy for export.

- `monomial_sets`

The monomial sets that generate the moment matrix blocks.

- `monomial_index`

Dictionary that maps monomials to SDP variables.

- `constraints`

The complete set of constraints after preprocesssing.

- `primal`

The primal optimal value.

- `dual`

The dual optimal value.

- `x_mat`

The primal solution matrix.

- `y_mat`

The dual solution matrix.

- `solution_time`

The amount of time taken to solve the relaxation.

- `status`

The solution status of the relaxation.

class qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.MoroderHierarchy(variables, parameters=None, verbose=0, normalized=True, ppt=False, parallel=False)ÔÉÅ

Bases: qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.sdp_relaxation.SdpRelaxation

Class for obtaining a step in the Moroder hierarchy (doi:10.1103/PhysRevLett.111.030501) :param variables: Commutative or noncommutative, Hermitian or nonhermiatian

variables, possibly a list of list of variables if the hierarchy is not NPA.

Parameters:

  • parameters (list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator or a list of list.) ‚Äì Optional symbolic variables for which moments are not generated.

  • verbose (int.) ‚Äì

    Optional parameter for level of verbosity:

    • 0: quiet

    • 1: verbose

    • 2: debug level

  • normalized (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter for changing the normalization of states over which the optimization happens. Turn it off if further processing is done on the SDP matrix before solving it.

  • ppt (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to impose a partial positivity constraint on the moment matrix.

- `monomial_sets`

The monomial sets that generate the moment matrix

blocks.
- `monomial_index`

Dictionary that maps monomials to SDP variables.

- `constraints`

The complete set of constraints after preprocesssing.

- `primal`

The primal optimal value.

- `dual`

The dual optimal value.

- `x_mat`

The primal solution matrix.

- `y_mat`

The dual solution matrix.

- `solution_time`

The amount of time taken to solve the relaxation.

- `status`

The solution status of the relaxation.

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.generate_operators(name, n_vars=1, hermitian=None, commutative=False)ÔÉÅ

Generates a number of commutative or noncommutative operators

Parameters:

  • name (str.) ‚Äì The prefix in the symbolic representation of the noncommuting variables. This will be suffixed by a number from 0 to n_vars-1 if n_vars > 1.

  • n_vars (int.) ‚Äì The number of variables.

  • hermitian (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to request Hermitian variables .

  • commutative (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to request commutative variables. Commutative variables are Hermitian by default.

Returns:

list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator variables

Example:

>>> generate_variables('y', 2, commutative=True)
Ôøº[y0, y1]
qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.generate_variables(name, n_vars=1, hermitian=None, commutative=True)ÔÉÅ

Generates a number of commutative or noncommutative variables

Parameters:

  • name (str.) ‚Äì The prefix in the symbolic representation of the noncommuting variables. This will be suffixed by a number from 0 to n_vars-1 if n_vars > 1.

  • n_vars (int.) ‚Äì The number of variables.

  • hermitian (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to request Hermitian variables .

  • commutative (bool.) ‚Äì Optional parameter to request commutative variables. Commutative variables are Hermitian by default.

Returns:

list of sympy.physics.quantum.operator.Operator or sympy.physics.quantum.operator.HermitianOperator variables or sympy.Symbol

Example:

>>> generate_variables('y', 2, commutative=True)
Ôøº[y0, y1]

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.fermionic_constraints(a)ÔÉÅ

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.maximum_violation(A_configuration, B_configuration, I, level, extra=None)ÔÉÅ

Get the maximum violation of a two-party Bell inequality.

Parameters:

  • A_configuration (list of int.) ‚Äì Measurement settings of Alice.

  • B_configuration (list of int.) ‚Äì Measurement settings of Bob.

  • I (list of list of int.) ‚Äì The I matrix of a Bell inequality in the Collins-Gisin notation.

Returns:

qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.define_objective_with_I(I, *args)ÔÉÅ

Define a polynomial using measurements and an I matrix describing a Bell inequality.

Parameters:

  • I (list of list of int.) ‚Äì The I matrix of a Bell inequality in the Collins-Gisin notation.

  • args ‚Äì Either the measurements of Alice and Bob or a Probability class describing their measurement operators.

Returns:

sympy.core.expr.Expr ‚Äì the objective function to be solved as a minimization problem to find the maximum quantum violation. Note that the sign is flipped compared to the Bell inequality.

class qrem.common.external.ncpol2sdpa.Probability(*args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

get_all_operators()ÔÉÅ

Return all operators across all parties and measurements to supply them to the ncpol2sdpa.SdpRelaxation class.

_monomial_generator(monomials, label_indices)ÔÉÅ
get_extra_monomials(*args)ÔÉÅ
_convert_marginal_index(marginal)ÔÉÅ
__call__(output_, input_, marginal=None)ÔÉÅ

Obtain your probabilities in the p(ab‚Ä¶|xy‚Ä¶) notation.

Parameters:

  • output (list of ints.) ‚Äì Conditional output as [a, b, ‚Ä¶]

  • input (list of ints.) ‚Äì The input to condition on as [x, y, ‚Ä¶]

  • marginal (list of str.) ‚Äì Optional parameter. If it is a marginal, then you can define which party or parties it belongs to.

Returns:

polynomial of sympy.physics.quantum.HermitianOperator.

Example:

For the CHSH scenario, to get p(10|01), write

P([1,0], [0,1])

To get the marginal p_A(0|1), write

P([0], [1], [‚ÄòA‚Äô])
